column4: is there a way to run a custom kernel that i just installed if it's compiled without initrd? grub tries to run initrd by default and it all fails
just don't add an initrd line
also check to make sure kopts is not set
and it says about missing root etc. (kernel panic)
it's pointing to the same device as in the previous kernel
you might be missing the driver your your hard drive
it's a sata device - i didn't really see antything for sata in config
i think it is folded in with the scsi stuff in 2.6.20
ok looks like i need to start from scratch then :/ thank you
but don't you think it has to do with missing initrd image?
even though there is no initrd line for that kernel in grub
you do not need an initrd
